snippet: The family of Robyn Benson, who sustained a fatal brain hemorrhage, hopes her fetus will mature enough to be delivered.
abstract: Pregnant Canadian woman Robyn Benson remains on life support nearly six weeks after she was declared brain-dead due to her family's hope that her fetus will mature enough to be delivered; Benson's situation differs significantly from case of Marlise Munoz, Texas woman whose family successfully sought court order to end life support, because Benson's husband agrees with family and fetus remains healthy and growing.

byline.contributor: Denise Grady contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The family of Robyn Benson, who sustained a fatal brain hemorrhage, hopes her fetus will mature enough to be delivered.

headline.main: Brain-Dead, a Canadian Woman Remains a Silent Partner Awaiting Birth
headline.print_headline: Brain-Dead, a Canadian Woman Remains a Silent Partner Awaiting Birth
